intro: Centaurea gentilii, commonly known as the sweet centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Centaurea gentilii is also known for its historical use in herbal medicine.
